infoBox.title: What are reduction reasons?
infoBox.title_easy: What are reasons for shorter training?
infoBox.content:
Reduction reasons are circumstances or qualifications that allow you to shorten the regular training duration. This can help you complete your training faster.

How are they applied?

Reduction reasons are credited to the regular training duration. Depending on the type of reason, different reductions may be granted. The reductions are added together until a maximum is reached.

How many can be used simultaneously?

You can specify multiple reduction reasons simultaneously. The total reduction is calculated from all selected reasons. However, note that there is a maximum reduction of 21 months that cannot be exceeded.
infoBox.content_easy:
Reasons for shorter training are things that can make your training shorter. For example: a school degree or work experience.

How does it work?

Each reason makes training shorter by some months. All reasons are added together.

How many reasons can I use?

You can use many reasons together. All reasons are added up. But training can be at most 21 months shorter.

para7a.title: § 7a BBiG – Part-time Vocational Training
para7a.description: Regulates the option to complete training on a part-time basis (at least 50% of full-time).
para7a.description_easy: This law says: Training can be part-time. You must work at least 50%.

para8.title: § 8 BBiG – Shortening and Extension
para8.description: Defines the options for shortening the training duration (e.g. through school qualifications, age, professional experience).
para8.description_easy: This law says: Training can be shorter. For example with school degree or work experience.

disclaimer.title: Important Notice
disclaimer.text: There is no legal entitlement to the shortening reasons. All shortenings must be agreed with the training company and the responsible chamber. This calculator does not replace legal advice.
disclaimer.text_easy: You have no automatic right to shorter training. You must agree with your training company and the chamber. This calculator does not replace legal advice.
